addActivity

public void addActivity(IAeActivity aActivity)
Description copied from interface: IAeActivityParent
Adds the activity to this parent. The method implies that there may be more than 1 activity as a child of this parent. This is a side effect of deciding to have a single interface to handle cases with a single child and those with multiple children.

Specified by:
addActivity in interface IAeActivityParent
See Also:
IAeActivityParent.addActivity(org.activebpel.rt.bpel.IAeActivity)

getChildrenForStateChange

public java.util.Iterator getChildrenForStateChange()
Description copied from interface: IAeBpelObject
Returns an Iterator for the bpel object's child objects which participate in the state change propagation. For structured activities, this merely returns an Iterator for the child activity or activities. In some cases though, like Scope, we're returning objects in addition to the single child activity. This is because scope needs to propagate the
